benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/invoicePayments/{paymentId}/customFields - Modify custom fields to payment

covered: PUT Valid Request: Tests cover successful updates with required headers (TC01) and optional headers (TC02).
Successful modification when no custom fields initially (TC03).
Removal of existing custom fields via empty array (TC04).
Error handling for invalid paymentId format (TC05).
404 Not Found when paymentId not existing (TC06).
400 Bad Request when required header is missing (TC07).
400 Bad Request when request body is missing (TC08).
400 Bad Request when body contains malformed JSON (TC09).
400 Bad Request when CustomField objects are invalid (TC10).
500 Internal Server Error when DB unavailable (TC12).
400/422 for security injection in custom field value (TC13).
Max length constraints for field values (TC15).
Handling of extra unexpected properties in body (TC16).
Integration test ensuring data consistency after update (TC17).
Regression handling of duplicate field names (TC18).
gaps: Partial Update behavior not explicitly tested (PUT vs full replace).
Explicit concurrency control (e.g., ETag/If-Match) not tested.
Caching behavior (ETag, Cache-Control headers) not tested.
Header value validation beyond presence (invalid header values or names) not tested.
Tests for other potential DB failure modes (503, timeouts) not present.
recommendations: Add explicit partial update semantics test to verify PUT requires full update or define allowed partial updates.
Introduce concurrency-control tests using ETag/If-Match and test for conflicting updates causing 409 (Conflict) or proper handling.
Add rate-limiting tests to verify 429 responses under load.
Add caching-header tests (ETag/Cache-Control) and verify caching behavior.
Add tests for invalid header values/names (e.g., non-ASCII, reserved headers).
Add 503 Service Unavailable tests for DB outages or network failures.
Keep TC17 intact; ensure its reliability for data consistency under repeated updates.
